e4: I recommend holding off on changing to the new policy until we have a detailed analysis of potential investor reactions and  market volatility. Prioritizing transparency with investors while minimizing market uncertainty is crucial before making any drastic changes to our reporting.
e5: Ethical reporting policies prioritize honesty and accuracy while aiming for fair market conditions. Transparency with financial data without being overtly manipulative is crucial.  Context matters! Investors react strongly to deviations from standard metrics, and ethical reporting helps build trust between investors and the company. For instance, acknowledging the prior manipulation but shifting to transparent, unadulterated reporting establishes accountability.
e6: Yes.  In particular, I would explore how long we anticipate holding back on disclosing this change before formally stating the new policy. How will market volatility affect investor interactions? We can assess our ability to weather any potential storm more accurately with data analysis and communication plans in place.
